content.text:
Thank you for choosing OpaciTool to assist with your visible emissions observations and reporting. OpaciTool provides a visual reference tool when performing visible emissions observations. Additionally, OpaciTool can record observation data and screenshots for use in reports.

 This tutorial will explain the settings of the OpaciTool application and the difference between the two modes of OpaciTool; Test Mode and Reference Mode.

Let’s start with downloading the OpaciTool app to your phone or tablet. OpaciTool is available for both Android and Apple devices.  Simply search for “OpaciTool” in the Google Play Store or the Apple App Store.
When you have downloaded the app to your device, sign-in using the credentials used to sign-in to your dashboard.  The sign-in credentials are the same for the app and your Dashboard.

sections.title: OpaciTool Settings
sections.description: If you need to change any of the default settings for the OpaciTool app, you can do so in the Settings menu.

subsections.heading: Permissions
subsections.description: OpaciTool will use your camera, GPS, compass and storage.  You must grant permission for each.

subsections.heading: Data Usage
subsections.description: Observation files can be large, especially with numerous screenshots. Observation files are uploaded to your dashboard using an internet connection. You can choose to upload these files over Wi-Fi only to minimize cellular data usage.

subsections.heading: Storage
subsections.description: By default, OpaciTool will save to a local folder on your device.  If you would like to save data to an SD card or a different folder, you can select  a new location. This feature is only available on Android devices.

subsections.heading: Help
subsections.description: Tap the question mark at the top to open the contact form.  Our Midwest-based team can help you with OpaciTool and Method 9 observations questions.

content.text:
You can view averages and data from previous observations under this section.  This is especially useful if you need to know the highest average immediately after the test. All of the data found under the Observations section is also available in your online Dashboard.

 If a test was accidentally stopped due to an application crash, power failure or unintentional exit, you can find and resume the interrupted test under the Observations section.

 You can also upload observations that were saved on your device when no internet connection was available.
There are two modes you can select from when using the OpaciTool app.  Both modes allow you to use the OpaciTool scale for visual reference but they differ in operation.

columns.title: Reference Mode
columns.description:
Reference Mode allows you to quickly compare visible emissions to the OpaciTool scale.  Screenshots are manually taken by the user.  Screenshots and opacity data are uploaded to your Dashboard where they can be viewed.

 Reference Mode is best used when you do not plan to create a report in the Dashboard or if you are recording observations on a paper form and want to supplement your report with screenshots.  A report can be created in your Dashboard when you use Reference Mode, but you will need to input most of the data manually.

columns.title: Test Mode
columns.description:
Test Mode allows you to perform timed opacity observations. You can set the duration of the test and the observation frequency. A screenshot and the associated opacity data will automatically be recorded based on the frequency you set. Test Mode also allows you to input details that will be needed to create a test report such as atmospheric data, facility information and observation location.

 Test Mode is best used when you plan to use the data to create a test report.  All data entered will be uploaded to your Dashboard and a report can be generated.
